info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 1:31AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: .Excessive rainfall over the last several hours has resulted in elevated streamflows in Burke County. This has resulted in ongoing flooding along John`s River in northern Burke County. Stream levels are still rising. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Burke. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...At 130 AM...the John`s River at Arneys Store had reached a level of 10.4 feet and rising. This is above the action stage of 8.5 feet. At 9 feet, PLAYMORE BEACH ROAD AND JOHNS RIVER ROAD AND OTHER BRIDGES OVER THE RIVER USUALLY BEGIN TO FLOOD NEAR THE CONFLUENCE OF WILSON CREEK AND JOHNS RIVER. AT 11.5 FEET, PARKING LOT OF THE BOAT RAMP AT NC 18/64 WILL FLOOD ON CORPENING BRIDGE ROAD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain earlier today, and river gauges now indicate rising stream levels. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.8 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Burke County along the John`s River - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
